The comment about your grandfather losing an eye was completely ineffective in justifying the main purpose of this video, which you would claim is to demonstrate what happens if you were to suffer an eye injury and why you should wear eye protection.  This is where 'SmarterEveryDay' departs from 'science' and gets into the realm of morbid fascination with guns and their clearly designed purpose, i.e. violence.  I am not at all squeamish, and happily watch much more 'gory' stuff than this (e.g. "The Brain Scoop" by Emily Graslie).  However, I have to say that your education message is inappropriately, and all too frequently, infused with guns.  Unsubscribing.  (And before anyone dismisses this as a comment by a 'liberal', or an anti-gun person - I spent 9 years in the army in the infantry.  I understand as well as anyone else what guns are for.)

Destin, this is very old as I only just watched your video, but the "eye squiggly" is actually an occurrence known as the Blue Field Entoptic Phenomenon. You are witnessing white blood cells in the capillaries located in front of the retina. White blood cells do not absorb blue light, therefore transmitting an image to the brain as if it where actually floating outside the eye. Also, they always "avoid" your direct gaze because there are no blood vessels in the Fovea Centralis, the seeing part.
